comments.author: Sharlin
comments.content: > when will we finally have quadratic surfaces or some other solution for that?Truly quadratic? Not with any technology resembling current GPUs which are all about computing strictly linear (/affine) functions as fast as possible. Plausible approximate dynamic level-of-detail approach? That was first used by Quake III Arena in 1999, widely advertised as being able to render truly curved surfaces (which was of course not the case, it just tessellated Bezier patches/splines in real time).We've had tessellation shaders for a long time now, able to dynamically subdivide surfaces to approximate round shapes on the fly on the GPU. The fact that there are still polygonal barrels is likely mostly about what things to prioritize.The Holy Grail of real-time rendering is probably micropolygons – the ability to render the whole scene using polygons a fraction of the size of a single output pixel, something that off-line renderers like Pixar's RenderMan have done since the early 90s. There are reasons why GPUs are not very good at rendering a lot of extremely small polygons, leading to approaches such as Epic's Nanite virtualized geometry in Unreal Engine 5 which basically implements a software renderer running on GPU compute shaders.
comments.content_cn: 我们何时才能拥有真正的二次曲面或其他解决方案？真正的二次曲面？目前任何类似现有GPU的技术都无法实现，因为GPU的核心是尽可能快地计算严格的线性（或仿射）函数。那么近似动态细节层次方法是否可行？这种方法最早在1999年的《雷神之锤3：竞技场》中使用，被广泛宣传为能够渲染真正的曲面（当然事实并非如此，它只是实时细分了贝塞尔曲面片/样条曲线）。我们拥有曲面细分着色器已有很长时间，能够在GPU上动态细分曲面以近似圆形。如今仍存在多边形桶状物体，很可能主要是关于开发重点的取舍问题。实时渲染的终极目标可能是微多边形——能够使用小于单个输出像素尺寸的多边形来渲染整个场景，皮克斯的RenderMan等离线渲染器自90年代初就已实现这一点。GPU在处理大量极小的多边形时存在不足，这促使了诸如Epic在虚幻引擎5中推出的Nanite虚拟化几何等技术，其本质是在GPU计算着色器上运行的软件渲染器。

comments.author: sho_hn
comments.content: A lot of what is shown here comes down to the people in the art asset and level pipeline.The real story to tell would be what tooling was used to pre-bake the lighing in the textures, e.g. if they used a seperate rendering package or mostly painted by hand, or in what mix.Also what guidelines they used to make sure the baked-in reflections would match the use and environmental lighing of objects in the scene, e.g. just general constraints or how much customization there was for important unique arrangements. Is it done by the same person in a tight loop or did it involve hand-ofs, etc.The excellence of the result is down to a lot of tasteful choices in how to blend these techniques, achieved either from experience or iteration.As programmers we tend to focus a lot on the raw rendering techniques, but there's a whole systematic practice around art direction and how to achieve and maintain quality in it that feels I guess softer and less deterministic but is still worth talking at length about.This especially struck me when the reviewer here recommended using multiple stacked texture planes and parallax mapping to improve things. I know a handful of games that have done this, and unless used exceedingly sparingly (e.g. mesh fence over pipes or something, where the foreground isn't expected to have a lot of depth) in my experience it very quickly gives away the illusion and looks very hokey. Humans are good at telling it's planes sliding over each other and doesn't correspond to their experience with depth perception. It also makes a scene a lot busier as the camera is moved, firing "something is changing here!" perceptual sinals all over the screen (note how all the lavish particle effects are about feedback instead), and is not the atmosphere Max Payne was trying to achieve.In other words, sometimes it's about knowing what possible thing not to do, too. And a lot of magic happens when disciplines meet.

posts.title: I'm making a game engine based on dynamic signed distance fields (SDFs) [video]
posts.author: imagiro
posts.title_cn: 我正在开发一款基于动态有向距离场（SDF）的游戏引擎 [视频]
posts.abstract:
该帖子讨论了一个基于动态有向距离场（SDF）的游戏引擎开发项目。核心话题围绕开发者展示的引擎技术，特别是其利用SDF实现高自由度地形变形和交互的潜力。

社区普遍对项目表示赞赏，认为演示效果令人印象深刻，且引擎设计思路新颖。有人认为这种技术能实现“高保真”的挖掘玩法，超越《无人深空》等游戏的现有地形系统；也有用户指出分层交互机制（如设置不同SDF层控制树木、地面或生物间的互动）为游戏设计提供了灵活性。讨论中提到，物理引擎Jolt Physics在3A游戏中的成功应用，增强了大家对这类底层技术开发价值的认同。

分歧点主要集中在技术优化层面：例如有用户探讨是否可用ReLU场降低缓存网格分辨率并提升重建精度，体现了对性能细节的不同关注。整体而言，社区肯定该项目为“从零开始”的游戏开发提供了创新方向，并期待其在玩法上的进一步探索。

So maybe the two technologies will converge. The guy who did the initial research for Nanite (his talk also cites Dreams ofc) said that voxels weren't practical. But I guess they hit the limits of what they can do with pixel-sized triangles.

I find it hard to imagine even a 2000 page pre-planning could capture that process.You could try planning ahead and restricting assets to an asset library, that could fix some of that problem. The development of a game is usually the stylistic input of dozens to thousands of humans over the course of years. They are not trivial pursuits. There's a lot of variance in there, but generally speaking I expect this to be one of the final frontiers for AI development. comments.author: dahart
comments.content: There are lots of reasons you don’t see a lot of SDF skeletal rigging & animation in games. It’s harder because the distance evaluations get much more expensive when you attach a hierarchy of warps and transforms, and there are typically a lot of distance evaluations when doing ray-marching. This project reduces the cost by using a voxel cache, but animated stuff thwarts the caching, so you have to limit the amount of animation.  Another reason it’s more difficult to rig & animate SDFs is because you only get a limited set of shapes that have analytic distance functions, or you have primitives and blending and warping that break Lipschitz conditions in your distance field, which is a fancy way of saying it’s easy to break the SDF and there are only limited and expensive ways to fix it. SDFs are much better at representing procedural content than the kind of mesh modeling involved in character animation and rendering.
comments.content_cn: 游戏中很少见到SDF骨骼绑定与动画的原因有很多。主要难点在于：当引入一系列扭曲和变换层级时，距离评估的计算成本会大幅增加，而光线步进过程中通常需要进行大量距离评估。本项目通过体素缓存降低了成本，但动态动画会破坏缓存机制，因此必须限制动画数量。另一个难点是，SDF绑定与动画只能使用有限的可解析距离函数形状，或者采用会破坏距离场利普希茨条件的图元混合与扭曲技术——这本质上意味着SDF极易失效，且修复手段有限且成本高昂。相较于角色动画渲染所涉及的网格建模，SDF更适合表现程序化生成的内容。
